answers.answer: I have them too always in the shower oddly. I have good blood pressure no other red flags for pre-eclampsia. Just really strange, I had with my other to pregnancy too.
I get them too. And mostly in the shower as well. So weird.

I have them all the time but I had them severely when I had eclampsia and when I had preeclampsia....maybe you have them from the increase in blood volume from pregnancy? not a doctor, just a guess :)
Its usually a sign of a headache or a migraine that is coming on.

I get floaters, have done for years. Mainly when outside in the daylight, can be worse when it's overcast and all grey/white clouds. Glasses minimise them but unfortunately not a whole lot can be done with them. My optician says it's fine so long as they're not black.

Luckily no preclampsia (knock on wood). They are like a black/silvery color. Mostly silver. Ive a contact lens wearer for over 10 years now. Before pregnancy i only got them when i stood up quickly. Im gonna give my ophthalmologist a call tomorrow

question: Anyone have floaters in their vision? Each appt i get my blood prssure checked and its normal. I randomly get them. Theyre not brought on by sudden movements or sudden pressure (ex. Standing up too fast)
title: floaters
